page.title: 05Guides at Wroxton Abbey.
page.content: On Saturday evening June 29th 1985 the Guides from the Banbury District went to a singalong for Guides, Brownies and their friends. This was to end the week of celebration for the Guides 75th Anniversary. The event was held in the grounds of Wroxton Abbey, which is now part of the Fairligh Dickinson University of New Jersey U.S.A. Admission was by ticket and on arrival people were given a programme. Everyone found a space on the grass to sit and at 7.00pm the singing started. The songs sung included Tzena, Theres a hole in my bucket, and Mouse in a windmill. At 8.00pm there was break and people were able to get something to eat. The singing restarted at 8.30pm. and continued until about 9.00pm., when everybody returned home.
